title: Meta needs better enforcement
text: This app is better about enforcing rules, although itâ€™s still meta and doesnâ€™t do it well. Thereâ€™s still very much hatred, racism, sexism, and stochastic terrorism being promoted pretty well unchecked as the report option is still limited to meta enforcement. The app itself is more enjoyable than Facebook and instagram but Zuckerberg has allotted all of his resources here and itâ€™s still mediocre at best in terms of keeping the bad off of the app. This is probably the best social media app today, and itâ€™s still owned and operated by meta so take that for what it is. Certain topics will be surpressed like the Gaza situation and it often times seems like itâ€™s surpressed in the wrong direction and allows hatred to flourish unhampered.

title: Promising alternatives
text: This app, like many others is seeking to fill the void left behind by original Twitter while it doesnâ€™t quite hit the mark, itâ€™s definitely a suitable alternative. Although there is far more censorship on this platform than any other app like it , it still stands on its own pretty well. While there are definitely alternatives that are better and get updated more regularly Threads has more than enough content to get you through a small scrolling session. It must be said though it does feel like a lot of news on threads arrives late or not at all in comparison to â€œXâ€ so if youâ€™re more interested in keeping up with current events right as they happen this really isnâ€™t much of an alternative unfortunately .
